svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
July 1, 2023" date: "2023-07-01"
* Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim : Deneb
upgrade Engine API changes: deprecate Merge config exchange and proposed flag for EL to
suggest local block building EIP7251 (increase max effective balance) discussion E-star
name upgrade candidate for inclusion: EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits)
Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
* Deneb upgrade Engine API changes: deprecate Merge config exchange and proposed flag
for EL to suggest local block building
Deneb upgrade Engine API changes: deprecate Merge config exchange and proposed flag for
EL to suggest local block building
* E-star name upgrade candidate for inclusion: EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits)
E-star name upgrade candidate for inclusion: EIP7002 (EL triggerable exits)
* EIP4844: EIP4844 devnet 7 launched (same spec as devnet 6) Latest EIP4844 implementer
call video . Notes from Terence . Devnet 8 should include Dencun EIPs
* EIP4844 devnet 7 launched (same spec as devnet 6)
EIP4844 devnet 7 launched (same spec as devnet 6)
* Latest EIP4844 implementer call video . Notes from Terence . Devnet 8 should include
Latest EIP4844 implementer call video . Notes from Terence . Devnet 8 should include
* Execution-spec-tests v1.0.0 : upgraded to PyTest, EIP4844 tests
Execution-spec-tests v1.0.0 : upgraded to PyTest, EIP4844 tests
* Holešky testnet (Goerli successor) coordination call notes : 1.7M validators planned,
with 800k run by client teams, genesis planned for September 15 (Merge day)
Holešky testnet (Goerli successor) coordination call notes : 1.7M validators planned,
* MEV-Boost v1.6 : additional data availability and logging improvements
MEV-Boost v1.6 : additional data availability and logging improvements
* Proposal to remove RIPEMD-160 & blake2f precompiles
Proposal to remove RIPEMD-160 & blake2f precompiles
* Consensus layer: Lodestar v1.9.1 : patch for peering/attestation issues & logging UX
Nimbus v23.6.1 : database pruning performance improvement for history prior to April
* Lodestar v1.9.1 : patch for peering/attestation issues & logging UX
Lodestar v1.9.1 : patch for peering/attestation issues & logging UX
* Nimbus v23.6.1 : database pruning performance improvement for history prior to April
* Execution layer: Besu v23.4.4 : new flat database improves block processing time &
attestation performance, BlobDB for non-state blockchain data improves sync time & disk
* Besu v23.4.4 : new flat database improves block processing time & attestation
performance, BlobDB for non-state blockchain data improves sync time & disk IO
* BaseSAP : stealth address protocol, extendable for particular cryptographic schemes
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7229 : Minimal upgradable proxy contract ERC7231 :
Identity aggregated NFT ERC7246 : Encumber (ERC20 extension) ERC7253 : Universal wallet
* Remix v0.34.0 : EVM version label, adds SolHint linter to Solidity analyzers,
Etherscan contract verification adds L2 support, constructor arguments & proxy support
Remix v0.34.0 : EVM version label, adds SolHint linter to Solidity analyzers, Etherscan
contract verification adds L2 support, constructor arguments & proxy support
* Foundry: ForGePT : trained on Foundry book & Telegram support channel, OpenAI API key
* ForGePT : trained on Foundry book & Telegram support channel, OpenAI API key required
* Solidity events : guide to logging and using web3.js to retrieve/listen
Solidity events : guide to logging and using web3.js to retrieve/listen
* Viem v1.2 : extend a client with custom actions
Viem v1.2 : extend a client with custom actions
* Raw transaction signing script using ethers.js
Raw transaction signing script using ethers.js
* Overview of Python ecosystem : web3.py, py-evm, eth-tester, Ape, Woke, Vyper &
Overview of Python ecosystem : web3.py, py-evm, eth-tester, Ape, Woke, Vyper &
* Noble-ciphers : Salsa20, ChaCha, Poly1305 & AES-SIV in JavaScript, no dependencies
Noble-ciphers : Salsa20, ChaCha, Poly1305 & AES-SIV in JavaScript, no dependencies
* Slither v0.9.4 & v0.9.5 patch: new detectors: cache-array-length,
encode-packed-collision & incorrect-using-for; new printer: lines of code; adds
interface generator and support for custom storage layouts
Slither v0.9.4 & v0.9.5 patch: new detectors: cache-array-length,
* RareSkills: Tornado Cash code base explainer
RareSkills: Tornado Cash code base explainer
* CTF: Decently Safe DeFi , 4 challenges, uses Foundry
CTF: Decently Safe DeFi , 4 challenges, uses Foundry
* Themis (lending) on Arbitrum $370k exploit via oracle manipulation
* EF academic grant recipients : 43 projects share $2 million in funding
EF academic grant recipients : 43 projects share $2 million in funding
* USDC Cross-Chain Transfer Protocol (CCTP) live on mainnet & Arbitrum
USDC Cross-Chain Transfer Protocol (CCTP) live on mainnet & Arbitrum
* Mirror Writing NFTs v2 : read post in NFT and open editions
Mirror Writing NFTs v2 : read post in NFT and open editions
* Diva (DVT liquid staking) DAO airdrop claimable by stakers, non-transferable so
presumably no taxes incurred, frontend blocks US/Canada
Diva (DVT liquid staking) DAO airdrop claimable by stakers, non-transferable so
* CLRFund round 9 live on Arbitrum, contribute to public goods
CLRFund round 9 live on Arbitrum, contribute to public goods
* Devconnect Istanbul: Production Assistant and Volunteer Coordinator
Devconnect Istanbul: Production Assistant and Volunteer Coordinator
* Solidity team need a highly skilled Developer Advocate
Solidity team need a highly skilled Developer Advocate
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable to abcoathup.eth.
* UK Financial Services & Markets act enables regulation of crypto
UK Financial Services & Markets act enables regulation of crypto
* HSBC Hong Kong allows customers to buy/sell Ether ETF
HSBC Hong Kong allows customers to buy/sell Ether ETF
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
* Jul 20–23 – Pragma Paris & ETHGlobal Paris hackathon
Jul 20–23 – Pragma Paris & ETHGlobal Paris hackathon
* Aug 28-30 – Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford University)
Aug 28-30 – Science of Blockchain Conference (Stanford University)
* Oct 13–15 – Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
Oct 13–15 – Ethereum Kuala Lumpur conference & hackathon
* Oct 31 – Road to Devcon grants application deadline
Oct 31 – Road to Devcon grants application deadline
Sign up to receive this newsletter weekly
